154.speaker: Minsc
154.text: Pain is a promise - that all our enemies' blows have not killed us, and will be heaped back upon their heads ten-fold!
154.context: NodeContext: Fierce - proud that Shadowheart gets it

53.speaker: Minsc
53.text: 'Lady of Loss'. I see now, Boo - because she is always losing.
53.context: NodeContext: Snort of derision, mocking the goddess

3.speaker: Minsc
3.text: So the plot for the Astral Prism was just another game between the gods. Some day, Boo may have to go up there and give them a talking to.
3.context: NodeContext: Optional moment to have Boo squeak at start of line.

7.speaker: Minsc
7.text: Do not be sad, Boo. Karlach vanquished a villain today. As for the rest of it... well.
7.context: NodeContext: Optional moment to have Boo squeak at start of line.

207.speaker: Minsc
207.text: We will find a way to save her, will we not?
207.context: NodeContext: Pointed, innocent - he's not really speaking to Boo, he's indirectly speaking to Karlach

265.speaker: Player
265.text: You don't need to give me false hope, Minsc.
265.context: NodeContext: Pointed, innocent - he's not really speaking to Boo, he's indirectly speaking to Karlach

191.speaker: Minsc
191.text: I was speaking to Boo. Reminding him of all the times that things seemed darkest, and how we still found the light in the end.
191.context: NodeContext: Pointed, innocent - he's not really speaking to Boo, he's indirectly speaking to Karlach

108.speaker: Minsc
108.text: And I will also remind him that there is no such thing as 'false' hope. Only hope itself.

225.speaker: Minsc
225.text: You see, Boo! You quiver in vain.

140.speaker: Minsc
140.text: This is why you have Minsc. He knows that the knowing matters not - only the doing!

5.speaker: Minsc
5.text: In the meantime, perhaps we can find a way to bring Lord Gortash back. Perhaps it would lift Karlach's spirits to kill him a second time.

170.speaker: Minsc
170.text: In the meantime, perhaps we can find a way to bring Lord Gortash back. It would be good to kill him a second time - for Boo, I mean.

122.speaker: Player
122.text: Are you trying to lie to me, or your hamster?

186.speaker: Minsc
186.text: Minsc does not lie. And heroes do not let their friends die - yes?

8.speaker: Minsc
8.text: Goddess or no, it is a fearsome sting to be let down by a lover. And to hear of it from another of her brightbirds!
8.context: NodeContext: Pause in conversation as Minsc promises to stop talking about Elminster having sex. Then immediately launches back into it.

166.speaker: Minsc
166.text: It must be difficult for you to imagine great Elminster a-courting. Writing poems. Doing... certain... deeds.
166.context: NodeContext: Pause in conversation as Minsc promises to stop talking about Elminster having sex. Then immediately launches back into it.

41.speaker: Minsc
41.text: It must be difficult for Gale to imagine great Elminster a-courting. Writing poems. Doing... certain... deeds.
41.context: NodeContext: Pause in conversation as Minsc promises to stop talking about Elminster having sex. Then immediately launches back into it.

64.speaker: Gale
64.text: Long before my time, thank goodness. That's not an image I care to dwell on.
64.context: NodeContext: Pause in conversation as Minsc promises to stop talking about Elminster having sex. Then immediately launches back into it.

22.speaker: Minsc
22.text: Ugh. It is difficult for Minsc to think of, too. Let us speak no more of it.
22.context: NodeContext: Pause in conversation as Minsc promises to stop talking about Elminster having sex. Then immediately launches back into it.

29.speaker: Minsc
29.context: NodeContext: Pause in conversation as Minsc promises to stop talking about Elminster having sex. Then immediately launches back into it.

88.speaker: Minsc
88.text: Of Elminster and the sex, I mean.

11.speaker: Minsc
11.text: Lorroakan thinks that tangling with Dame Aylin will lengthen his life? See, Boo? Wizards - they are just so stupid.
11.context: NodeContext: Amped up - Shadowheart defied Shar and freed her parents, even though it will allow Shar's curse to cause her pain for the rest of her life.

12.speaker: Minsc
12.text: Who among us has not been spurned by a lover? But a word of advice, if Minsc may be so bold:
12.context: NodeContext: Amped up - Shadowheart defied Shar and freed her parents, even though it will allow Shar's curse to cause her pain for the rest of her life.

69.speaker: Minsc
69.text: Lick your wounds, wizard. Write some rickety rhymes, and weep most manfully into your hamster's hide. Eh - your cat's hide.

249.speaker: Minsc
249.text: But... this boasting does not become you. 'Claim godhood'? This will make you any less a man with a half-mended heart?

230.speaker: Minsc
230.text: Let the wizard lick his wounds. Write some rickety rhymes, and weep most manfully into his hamster's hide. Eh - his cat's hide.

43.speaker: Minsc
43.text: But... his boasting is unbecoming. 'Claim godhood', he says? Will this make him any less a man with a half-mended heart?

16.speaker: Minsc
16.text: Hah! It is the heart of a berserker that beats in your chest! Shar thinks this pain is a punishment? No!
16.context: NodeContext: Amped up - Shadowheart defied Shar and freed her parents, even though it will allow Shar's curse to cause her pain for the rest of her life.

21.speaker: Minsc
21.text: Ugh. I have no wish to see what floaters will break about the water after out little visit down below.
21.context: NodeContext: A little taken aback - doesn't understand why we're so concerned about our friend being taken

24.speaker: Minsc
24.text: On your guard! Who knows how long that slipskin serpent was hiding in our camp.
24.context: NodeContext: A little taken aback - doesn't understand why we're so concerned about our friend being taken

163.speaker: Minsc
163.text: On your guard! Who knows how long that slipskin serpent was hiding in our camp.
163.context: NodeContext: A little taken aback - doesn't understand why we're so concerned about our friend being taken

15.speaker: Minsc
15.text: She might have been your pillow. Or Minsc's pillow. Or Jaheira's pillow!
15.context: NodeContext: A little taken aback - doesn't understand why we're so concerned about our friend being taken

185.speaker: Player
185.text: Or, perhaps, not a pillow at all.
185.context: NodeContext: A little taken aback - doesn't understand why we're so concerned about our friend being taken

25.speaker: Minsc
25.text: Bah. When Minsc catches hold of her, it will be his kicking that shifts her shape. Unless... could she be my boots...?

54.speaker: Minsc
54.text: No matter. Things are not so dire.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: Maybe she was pretending to be Boo.
59.context: NodeContext: A little taken aback - doesn't understand why we're so concerned about our friend being taken

117.speaker: Minsc
117.text: Please be serious, friend. She can mimic a form, yes - but not a hamster's obvious charisma. But perhaps - she was his pillow?

238.speaker: Player
238.text: I don't think that's how doppelgangers work.
238.context: NodeContext: A little taken aback - doesn't understand why we're so concerned about our friend being taken

83.speaker: Minsc
83.text: Suit yourself. But Minsc will stomp his bedding down each night all the same.

206.speaker: Player
206.text: Take this seriously. She has Gale.
206.context: NodeContext: A little taken aback - doesn't understand why we're so concerned about our friend being taken

56.speaker: Player
56.text: Take this seriously. She has Lae'zel.
56.context: NodeContext: A little taken aback - doesn't understand why we're so concerned about our friend being taken

149.speaker: Player
149.text: Take this seriously. She has Halsin.
149.context: NodeContext: A little taken aback - doesn't understand why we're so concerned about our friend being taken

189.speaker: Player
189.text: Take this seriously. She has Minthara.
189.context: NodeContext: A little taken aback - doesn't understand why we're so concerned about our friend being taken

9.speaker: Player
9.text: Take this seriously. She has Yenna.
9.context: NodeContext: A little taken aback - doesn't understand why we're so concerned about our friend being taken

112.speaker: Minsc
112.text: I... do not understand your concern. Perhaps once again, Minsc is missing something?
112.context: NodeContext: A little taken aback - doesn't understand why we're so concerned about our friend being taken

100.speaker: Minsc
100.text: Yes, Orin has taken the wizard. But he is our comrade - and so we are going to save him.
100.context: NodeContext: Kindly, but as if the player is very dense - yes Orin's a murderer, but there's no other outcome but as going to save our friend. So cheer up!

90.speaker: Minsc
90.text: Yes, Orin has taken the rude githyanki. But she is our comrade - and so we are going to save her.
90.context: NodeContext: Kindly, but as if the player is very dense - yes Orin's a murderer, but there's no other outcome but as going to save our friend. So cheer up!

76.speaker: Minsc
76.text: Yes, Orin has taken the bear-druid. But he is our comrade - and so we are going to save him.
76.context: NodeContext: Kindly, but as if the player is very dense - yes Orin's a murderer, but there's no other outcome but as going to save our friend. So cheer up!

17.speaker: Minsc
17.text: Yes, Orin has taken the loathsome drow. But she is our comrade - and so we are going to save her.
17.context: NodeContext: Kindly, but as if the player is very dense - yes Orin's a murderer, but there's no other outcome but as going to save our friend. So cheer up!

160.speaker: Minsc
160.text: Simple enough, no? So let us be about it!
160.context: NodeContext: Kindly, but as if the player is very dense - yes Orin's a murderer, but there's no other outcome but as going to save our friend. So cheer up!

128.speaker: Minsc
128.text: Yes, Orin has taken little Yenna. But she is relying on us to save her - and so that is what we are going to do.
128.context: NodeContext: Kindly, but as if the player is very dense - yes Orin's a murderer, but there's no other outcome but as going to save our friend. So cheer up!

26.speaker: Minsc
26.text: Come, then. If this gith prince is some saviour of prophecy, then let him take on the face of a fish.
26.context: NodeContext: Smug jubilance to irritation as he repeatedly fails to pronounce 'Orphic'

36.speaker: Minsc
36.text: Oh, damn it! To end a devil in the hells is to end him for true. Boo was hoping to make a hobby of killing Raphael over and over again.
36.context: NodeContext: Smug jubilance to irritation as he repeatedly fails to pronounce 'Orphic'

37.speaker: Minsc
37.text: Haha! From right beneath the devil's nose, we have stolen his orific - orphonic - ORF -
37.context: NodeContext: Smug jubilance to irritation as he repeatedly fails to pronounce 'Orphic'

116.speaker: Minsc
116.text: May I borrow this hammer, and beat whoever named it about the brains?

38.speaker: Minsc
38.text: To lose someone you love... Minsc and Boo know this feeling well.
38.context: NodeContext: Amped up - Shadowheart defied Shar and freed her parents, even though it will allow Shar's curse to cause her pain for the rest of her life.

75.speaker: Minsc
75.text: I am sorry, Wyll. I do not have the words. But Boo has the warmth, if you will let him share it a while.

46.speaker: Minsc
46.text: Minsc does not have the words. But Boo has warmth, if Wyll will let him share it a while.

50.speaker: Minsc
50.text: My hamster mislikes this, but I have assured him - you have some purpose to this play-acting.
50.context: NodeContext: Amped up - Shadowheart defied Shar and freed her parents, even though it will allow Shar's curse to cause her pain for the rest of her life.

200.speaker: Player
200.text: This is our path to Orin. Trust me.

113.speaker: Minsc
113.text: Of course I trust you, my friend. But remember:

244.speaker: Minsc
244.text: Minsc bent the knee, as you asked. But all four of Boo's little legs remain upright, and primed for Sarevok's tender parts.

32.speaker: Minsc
32.text: Guide us well, lest Boo take the reins and whip our butts back to the path of virtue.

215.speaker: Player
215.text: You've followed me this far. Just follow a little further.

52.speaker: Minsc
52.text: To forswear the strength of seven thousand souls - that is an act of true strength, says Boo.
52.context: NodeContext: Amped up - Shadowheart defied Shar and freed her parents, even though it will allow Shar's curse to cause her pain for the rest of her life.

6.speaker: Minsc
6.text: You may borrow Minsc's muscles whenever it is needful. Brave, powerful, puny Astarion!

62.speaker: Astarion
62.text: Yes - all right - that's more than enough comfort and support, thank you.

39.speaker: Minsc
39.text: Astarion may borrow Minsc's muscles whenever he is needful. Brave, powerful, puny Astarion!

61.speaker: Minsc
61.text: A clever ruse, my friend - the wizard will not think to flee. And when Aylin descends on him, he will have time to conjure naught but a puddle in his pantaloons.
61.context: NodeContext: Amped up - Shadowheart defied Shar and freed her parents, even though it will allow Shar's curse to cause her pain for the rest of her life.

63.speaker: Minsc
63.text: A few nonsense words, some slain beasts, and one becomes some all-powerful being? No - I do not believe it.
63.context: NodeContext: Amped up - Shadowheart defied Shar and freed her parents, even though it will allow Shar's curse to cause her pain for the rest of her life.

14.speaker: Minsc
14.text: You still have the look of a pale and puny child to me, Astarion. And you had best mind your appetite, lest Boo take to some night-time nibbling of his own.

105.speaker: Minsc
105.text: Astarion still has the look of a pale and puny child to me. And he had best mind his appetite, lest Boo take to some night-time nibbling of his own.

66.speaker: Minsc
66.text: Do not mourn Astarion. The Gur are known to be a just and righteous people among the Rashemaar.
66.context: NodeContext: Amped up - Shadowheart defied Shar and freed her parents, even though it will allow Shar's curse to cause her pain for the rest of her life.

145.speaker: Minsc
145.text: They named Astarion monster, and so monster he was. Yes, Boo - even if he sometimes seemed a friend.

68.speaker: Minsc
68.text: Night-time raids are considered the height of rudeness in Rashemen. We shall find them, and retrieve Astarion.
68.context: NodeContext: Amped up - Shadowheart defied Shar and freed her parents, even though it will allow Shar's curse to cause her pain for the rest of her life.

178.speaker: Minsc
178.text: But more than this, we shall teach them to slaughter by dawn like civilised folk. Now - Boo demands his blankets once more.

74.speaker: Minsc
74.text: Hah! The heart of a berserker beats in the cleric's chest! Shar thinks this pain is a punishment? No!
74.context: NodeContext: Amped up - Shadowheart defied Shar and freed her parents, even though it will allow Shar's curse to cause her pain for the rest of her life.

77.speaker: Minsc
77.text: Hah! The heart of a berserker beats in the cleric's chest! Shar thinks this pain is a punishment? No!
77.context: NodeContext: Amped up - Shadowheart defied Shar and freed her parents, even though it will allow Shar's curse to cause her pain for the rest of her life.

84.speaker: Minsc
84.text: This Mizora is quite pleased with herself, for one who stinks of the Hells.

49.speaker: Minsc
49.text: Evil and rotten eggs: both putrid beneath their pretty shells - and both offend Boo's innards.

102.speaker: Minsc
102.text: It can only be a good thing when gith war against gith. Minsc and Boo are simply grateful to be included.

103.speaker: Minsc
103.text: The Gur are honoured in Rashemen. They may have been blinded by grief, but still... they deserved better.

104.speaker: Minsc
104.text: Circled by devils and their dangling temptations - and still Wyll Ravengard chose the righteous path.
104.context: NodeContext: Squeak from Boo, and hushed aside from Minsc.

261.speaker: Minsc
261.text: You will not suffer beneath the devil's yoke for long. Mizora thinks herself protected by her paper - but Boo needs new scraps for his bedding.

171.speaker: Minsc
171.text: Wyll shall not suffer beneath the devil's yoke for long. Mizora thinks herself protected by her paper - but Boo needs new scraps for his bedding.

239.speaker: Minsc
239.text: An infernal contract. Sounds nice and cosy, does it not?

106.speaker: Minsc
106.text: This place could use a little sunshine. Keep a close eye for curtains, Boo!
106.context: NodeContext: Squeak from Boo, and hushed aside from Minsc.

114.speaker: Minsc
114.text: It was unwise of you to sign yourself over to Raphael. Everyone knows that a devil binds you by your name.
114.context: NodeContext: Squeak from Boo, and hushed aside from Minsc.

115.speaker: Minsc
115.text: It was unwise of you to sign yourself over to Raphael. Everyone knows that a devil binds you by your name.
115.context: NodeContext: Squeak from Boo, and hushed aside from Minsc.

172.speaker: Minsc
172.text: Unless... you used a false name, hm. You did, didn't you? Do not tell me, Minsc will guess! Something foolish, like...

107.speaker: Minsc
107.text: Shadowheart? No. Sharess! No, that was the name of the tavern. Tavern? Tav!

220.speaker: Minsc
220.text: No, you're right Boo. That is a stupid, stupid name.

121.speaker: Minsc
121.text: Boo and I know the sewers well. If you wish to purge the city of its wicked waste, you must sometimes crawl down into its bowels and push.
121.context: NodeContext: Squeak from Boo, and hushed aside from Minsc.

126.speaker: Minsc
126.text: The githyanki speaks of rebellion, bloody battle, and then makes plans to meet us in a tavern?
126.context: NodeContext: Squeak from Boo, and hushed aside from Minsc.

127.speaker: Minsc
127.text: A noble chant, is it not? Hail Wyll, Blade of Frontiers!
127.context: NodeContext: Squeak from Boo, and hushed aside from Minsc.

131.speaker: Minsc
131.text: A noble chant, is it not? Hail Wyll, Blade of Frontiers!
131.context: NodeContext: Squeak from Boo, and hushed aside from Minsc.

251.speaker: Minsc
251.text: No, Boo, I still do not understand what it means.
251.context: NodeContext: Squeak from Boo, and hushed aside from Minsc.

132.speaker: Minsc
132.text: Minsc has seen much of evil's ways. Enough to make him angry. To make him want to clutch at evil's throat and wring justice from it with his bare hands!
132.context: NodeContext: Futile anger at what he's just seen - Shadowheart choosing to follow Shar's path and sacrifice her family in order to have her painful memories of them erased. Line leads into deflated pity for SH afterwards.

82.speaker: Minsc
82.text: But... never before to make him feel so sad. Minsc and Boo... they can only pity you, cleric. For now.
82.context: NodeContext: Deflated, anger dissipating. Shadowheart is a Sharran and he'll stand against her when he must, but for now he only feels pity.

110.speaker: Minsc
110.text: But... never before to make him feel so sad. There is no justice in this. None at all.
110.context: NodeContext: Deflated, anger dissipating. Shadowheart is a Sharran and he'll stand against her when he must, but for now he only feels pity.

133.speaker: Minsc
133.text: My friend, I could lift this smith and rain little kisses upon his brow!
133.context: NodeContext: 'Oh' is an answer to Boo squeaking a quick explanation that the player is talking about sex.

94.speaker: Minsc
94.text: You can press flesh to flesh again! Do you know what this means?
94.context: NodeContext: 'Oh' is an answer to Boo squeaking a quick explanation that the player is talking about sex.

156.speaker: Player
156.text: That you want to press my flesh? I'm flattered.

146.speaker: Player
146.text: That you want to press my flesh? I'm flattered - but spoken for.

139.speaker: Minsc
139.text: Hah! Do not be alarmed to find him toasting on your engine some cold camp night. But that is not my meaning.

162.speaker: Minsc
162.text: Karlach can press flesh to flesh again! Do you know what this means?
162.context: NodeContext: 'Oh' is an answer to Boo squeaking a quick explanation that the player is talking about sex.

118.speaker: Player
118.text: I do. She and I can finally touch.
118.context: NodeContext: 'Oh' is an answer to Boo squeaking a quick explanation that the player is talking about sex.

227.speaker: Minsc
227.context: NodeContext: 'Oh' is an answer to Boo squeaking a quick explanation that the player is talking about sex.

190.speaker: Minsc
190.text: Oh. By the Three, can you not stow your smutty thoughts for a moment? There is more to life than the sound of slapping skin.
190.context: NodeContext: 'Oh' is an answer to Boo squeaking a quick explanation that the player is talking about sex.

250.speaker: Minsc
250.text: I speak of combat. Berserker bouts, in which warriors throw the full might of their fury against one another! In a friendly fashion, of course.
250.context: NodeContext: Preceded by Boo squeak. 'Huh' is a wry response to Boo saying he'd bet on Karlach in a fight against Minsc. Not mad - he knows his hamster is smart.

216.speaker: Player
216.context: NodeContext: Preceded by Boo squeak. 'Huh' is a wry response to Boo saying he'd bet on Karlach in a fight against Minsc. Not mad - he knows his hamster is smart.

135.speaker: Minsc
135.text: Boo says he will take that wager!
135.context: NodeContext: Preceded by Boo squeak. 'Huh' is a wry response to Boo saying he'd bet on Karlach in a fight against Minsc. Not mad - he knows his hamster is smart.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: Karlach is going to kick your arse.
60.context: NodeContext: Minsc is talking about finally being able to have practice bouts with Karlach, now she can touch again. The player has piped up to say she has bigger things on her mind, like the chance of having to return to Avernus. Karlach very much disagrees.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: Oh, I'm going to kick your arse.
0.context: NodeContext: Minsc is talking about finally being able to have practice bouts with Karlach, now she can touch again. The player has piped up to say she has bigger things on her mind, like the chance of having to return to Avernus. Karlach very much disagrees.

93.speaker: Minsc
93.text: Should I be so honoured, I will wear the boot-print of Karlach Demonsbane with pride.

263.speaker: Minsc
263.text: Do not hold back during our sparring. A berserker must enter battle with an empty mind.

30.speaker: Minsc
30.text: It will be a good chance for our friend to empty her mind of the news she just heard.

209.speaker: Minsc
209.text: When dark thoughts invade, it is a friend's duty to dislodge them. Be it by exercise, or repeated blows to the skull.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: Didn't you hear what else Dammon said? Karlach has bigger concerns than wrestling you.
67.context: NodeContext: Minsc is talking about finally being able to have practice bouts with Karlach, now she can touch again. The player has piped up to say she has bigger things on her mind, like the chance of having to return to Avernus. Karlach very much disagrees.

137.speaker: Karlach
137.context: NodeContext: Minsc is talking about finally being able to have practice bouts with Karlach, now she can touch again. The player has piped up to say she has bigger things on her mind, like the chance of having to return to Avernus. Karlach very much disagrees.

129.speaker: Minsc
129.text: It is exactly Karlach's concerns which concern Minsc. A berserker must enter battle with an empty mind.

111.speaker: Player
111.text: Maybe another time. Dammon's warning has me feeling a little off.

236.speaker: Minsc
236.text: It is exactly this off-ness I seek to address. A berserker must enter battle with an empty mind.

123.speaker: Player
123.text: You're excited. I didn't know you felt that way about Karlach.

161.speaker: Player
161.text: I'm sure you're going to tell me.

134.speaker: Minsc
134.text: Everyone else saw the large and leathern githyanki woman. Yes...?
134.context: NodeContext: Shaken by having watched / helped Shadowheart mercy kill her parents so that Shar couldn't keep torturing them.

136.speaker: Minsc
136.text: Everyone else saw the large and leathern githyanki woman. Yes...?
136.context: NodeContext: Shaken by having watched / helped Shadowheart mercy kill her parents so that Shar couldn't keep torturing them.

138.speaker: Minsc
138.text: Let us away, friend. Minsc and Boo are at your back. Your... slick and slippery back.
138.context: NodeContext: Shaken by having watched / helped Shadowheart mercy kill her parents so that Shar couldn't keep torturing them.

142.speaker: Minsc
142.text: Astarion's brother is known to me, I think. He once bought me drinks at that very bar, and was most eager to hold Boo.
142.context: NodeContext: Shaken by having watched / helped Shadowheart mercy kill her parents so that Shar couldn't keep torturing them.

234.speaker: Minsc
234.text: Perhaps we will see him again, when we walk into his master's trap.

143.speaker: Minsc
143.text: Gale reminds me of the vremyonni of my homeland. The man-mages of Rashemen.
143.context: NodeContext: Shaken by having watched / helped Shadowheart mercy kill her parents so that Shar couldn't keep torturing them.

144.speaker: Minsc
144.text: I might have called it an evil thing, once, to raise your hand to those who love you.
144.context: NodeContext: Shaken by having watched / helped Shadowheart mercy kill her parents so that Shar couldn't keep torturing them.

89.speaker: Minsc
89.text: But if Minsc was not saved from the cult - was used to hurt those who only meant to help him - I think that ending Minsc might have been a way of saving Minsc, too.

147.speaker: Minsc
147.text: A sad thing, to raise a child down in the darkness. Small wonder Shadowheart is so pale. And smelling of damp.
147.context: NodeContext: Knowing stage whisper - as if Shadowheart might not be standing right there

150.speaker: Minsc
150.text: You and Jaheira whisper much together, eh? You have grown close. Minsc is glad to see it - every hero needs hamster and hathran both.
150.context: NodeContext: Little nudge - not implying romance, just warmly stating that Jaheira seems to trust us. In fact, Jaheira just quietly said she doesn't trust us to take care of the city, but Minsc was 100% not listening.

153.speaker: Minsc
153.text: Step soft, my friend. Such places are full of traps, and Minsc is too often finding them with foot and face.
153.context: NodeContext: Squeak from Boo, and hushed aside from Minsc. He does not understand BG government at all.

155.speaker: Minsc
155.text: A noble chant, is it not? Hail Wyll, Grand Duke of Baldur's Gate!
155.context: NodeContext: Squeak from Boo, and hushed aside from Minsc. He does not understand BG government at all.

28.speaker: Minsc
28.text: What do you mean, Boo? Of course the people have voted for Wyll. I think.
28.context: NodeContext: Squeak from Boo, and hushed aside from Minsc. He does not understand BG government at all.

157.speaker: Minsc
157.text: Banites, battered gnomes, and not a single salty tang of honest sweat. No smith of Rashemen would call this place a forge.
157.context: NodeContext: Shaken by having watched / helped Shadowheart mercy kill her parents so that Shar couldn't keep torturing them. This is speaking to avatar Shadowheart, helplessly trying to comfort

174.speaker: Minsc
174.text: But I will take the head of the largest Watcher we can find. Boo may have need of a chamber pot.

165.speaker: Minsc
165.text: What we did might feel an evil thing, I know.
165.context: NodeContext: Shaken by having watched / helped Shadowheart mercy kill her parents so that Shar couldn't keep torturing them. This is speaking to avatar Shadowheart, helplessly trying to comfort

169.speaker: Minsc
169.text: If Karlach's mind is set, then Boo and I have faith. So bright a soul-fire cannot be quenched by any slippery fish-form.
169.context: NodeContext: Squeak from Boo, and hushed aside from Minsc.

177.speaker: Minsc
177.text: A noble chant, is it not? Hail Wyll, Blade of Avernus!
177.context: NodeContext: Squeak from Boo, and hushed aside from Minsc.

179.speaker: Minsc
179.text: A noble chant, is it not? Hail Wyll, Blade of Avernus!
179.context: NodeContext: Squeak from Boo, and hushed aside from Minsc.

109.speaker: Minsc
109.text: Well yes, Boo, the horseless chariots of Avernus are impressive too - but that would be no kind of name, would it?
109.context: NodeContext: Squeak from Boo, and hushed aside from Minsc.

184.speaker: Minsc
184.text: To take on the flayer-form... There must be another way to defeat the brain, surely? If not - better we fight on anyway, and die beautiful!
184.context: NodeContext: Suspicious, looking around - he's back in the Iron Throne, which has been sunk in the city's bay.

192.speaker: Minsc
192.text: Viconia always did like the darkness. Boo would chew holes in her tent to let the sunshine in. A most ungrateful one, this Mother Superior.
192.context: NodeContext: Suspicious, looking around - he's back in the Iron Throne, which has been sunk in the city's bay.

195.speaker: Minsc
195.text: Viconia always did like the darkness. Boo would chew holes in her tent to let the sunshine in. A most ungrateful one, this Mother Superior.
195.context: NodeContext: Suspicious, looking around - he's back in the Iron Throne, which has been sunk in the city's bay.

204.speaker: Minsc
204.text: There is something strangely familiar about this place. Almost as if Minsc and Boo have walked these halls before...
204.context: NodeContext: Suspicious, looking around - he's back in the Iron Throne, which has been sunk in the city's bay.

211.speaker: Minsc
211.text: There is something strangely familiar about this place. Almost as if Minsc and Boo have walked these halls before...
211.context: NodeContext: Suspicious, looking around - he's back in the Iron Throne, which has been sunk in the city's bay.

213.speaker: Minsc
213.text: There is something strangely familiar about this place. Almost as if Minsc and Boo have walked these halls before...
213.context: NodeContext: Suspicious, looking around - he's back in the Iron Throne, which has been sunk in the city's bay.

35.speaker: Minsc
35.text: Hah! No, Boo, the Iron Throne we once battled through was built by the docks, not beneath them.
35.context:
NodeContext: Boo squeaks at the start of this line, reminding Minsc they HAVE been to the Iron Throne before. Minsc is a little patronising, thinking his poor hamster is confused.
Ref: Boo_Talketive_SqueakyHighPitch_19

167.speaker: Minsc
167.text: Forgive my hamster. His cunning mind was made for the depths of space, not the depths of the ocean.
167.context:
NodeContext: Gently begging our pardons for Boo's 'confusion'. Puncuated by a surly squeak from Boo at the end.
Ref: shorter version of Boo_Talketive_Shy_Squeaks_02.

214.speaker: Minsc
214.text: This encounter has left me a little confused.
214.context: NodeContext: Player is in the Bhaal Temple

221.speaker: Minsc
221.text: This encounter has left me a little confused.
221.context: NodeContext: Player is in the Bhaal Temple

260.speaker: Minsc
260.text: The tyrant's mouth was moving for a very, very long time - and not once did you fill it with your fist.

262.speaker: Player
262.text: Because Gortash was offering us an alliance.

180.speaker: Minsc
180.text: The city taverns offer ale much like the squeezings of an ogre's small-pants. That does not mean Minsc must drink it.

248.speaker: Minsc
248.text: Two or three tankards at most, for avoiding of offence. I will bring you to such a place, to wash the tyrant from your tongue.

101.speaker: Player
101.text: Didn't you hear his warning? About the doppelganger in our midst?

219.speaker: Minsc
219.text: Minsc hears. He does not heed. Boo keeps only the company of heroes - and so none among our company could be anything else.

55.speaker: Minsc
55.text: But, if you must be certain, he will wriggle into a different bedroll each night. The first to complain, well - there you have it.

254.speaker: Player
254.text: The tyrant's time will come. Just not yet.

188.speaker: Minsc
188.text: You wish to show Minsc the ways of patience? Jaheira once tried, before it set her hair to greying.

197.speaker: Minsc
197.text: Bah. Pick your moment, then - and when you do, Minsc will pick wicked teeth from betwixt his fingers.

229.speaker: Minsc
229.text: Hmm. Boo remembers the scent of this place well. Watch for the wrinkling of his nose - and know that evil is near.
229.context: NodeContext: Player is in the Bhaal Temple

233.speaker: Minsc
233.text: Onward, then. If you are so set on taking the form of a fish, then Minsc and Boo will keep you from the Netherbrain's hook.
233.context: NodeContext: Jovial, thoughtful. Commenting on the vast Wyrmsway ruin we found.

235.speaker: Minsc
235.text: Minsc has crossed blades in the Blood War. Blown bubbles in the River Styx. He is no stranger to the Hells.
235.context: NodeContext: Jovial, thoughtful. Commenting on the vast Wyrmsway ruin we found.

187.speaker: Minsc
187.text: But to be met 'round every corner with another bronzed bust of the devil's bronzed bosoms... truly, this is damnation.

237.speaker: Minsc
237.text: There is more city under the city than in it, I think. I begin to wonder if Baldur's Gate was not built by some burrowing cousin of Boo's.
237.context: NodeContext: Jovial, thoughtful. Commenting on the vast Wyrmsway ruin we found.

241.speaker: Minsc
241.text: You remind me of the vremyonni of my homeland. The man-mages of Rashemen.
241.context: NodeContext: Pause for squeak before 'Yes Boo'.

217.speaker: Minsc
217.text: While the girl-folk go on to rule as wychlaran, Weave-touched boys were hidden away. Trained to work their craft in silence and secrecy.
217.context: NodeContext: Pause for squeak before 'Yes Boo'.

158.speaker: Minsc
158.text: It is an old custom, not well-observed. In truth I thought it born of caution, after some catastrophe wrought by wizardly men-folk of old.
158.context: NodeContext: Pause for squeak before 'Yes Boo'.

242.speaker: Minsc
242.text: Now I wonder if it was not done to hide them from Mystra, and the snares she sets for young and prideful boys, hm?
242.context: NodeContext: Pause for squeak before 'Yes Boo'.

196.speaker: Minsc
196.text: Though this suggests that Mystra has never tempted a witch into foolishness. Not that I would blaspheme by suggesting otherwise.
196.context: NodeContext: Pause for squeak before 'Yes Boo'.

218.speaker: Minsc
218.text: I forget why I began this long and winding story. Yes Boo - we have been spending too long around the wizard.
218.context: NodeContext: Pause for squeak before 'Yes Boo'.

243.speaker: Minsc
243.text: So. Our friend made the Absolute, and led the Bhaal cult? Boo will have words about this... But we can fix it. We fixed it before.
243.context: NodeContext: Grim, but grudgingly accepting that even though the player started the Absolute plot, they've changed - and have the chance to fix it.

78.speaker: Minsc
78.text: The Stone Lord had his chance. So shall the Bhaalspawn, says Boo.
78.context: NodeContext: Grim, but grudgingly accepting that even though the player started the Absolute plot, they've changed - and have the chance to fix it.

245.speaker: Minsc
245.text: Jaheira, littering the streets in broad daylight? I swear - sometimes, it is as if she does not care for this city at all.
245.context: NodeContext: Tutting - Jaheira either burned her timeless body scroll or threw it away in a gesture entrusting the protection of the city to the player. Minsc was not listening in the slightest.

246.speaker: Minsc
246.text: Everyone else saw the large and leathern githyanki woman. Yes...?
246.context: NodeContext: Sly squeak from Boo at start.

253.speaker: Minsc
253.text: You did well to spurn the devil's contract, my friend. Minsc's teachers always said he was better at bleeding than reading.
253.context: NodeContext: Sly squeak from Boo at start.

91.speaker: Minsc
91.text: It sounds like strange advice, but it has served me well in the past.

255.speaker: Minsc
255.text: Come! We've cracked through the Brain's city-shell. Boo would like a nibble at its soft and squishy centre.
255.context: NodeContext: Sly squeak from Boo at start.

257.speaker: Minsc
257.text: Night-time raids are the height of rudeness in Rashemen. Could they not have attacked by morning?
257.context: NodeContext: Sly squeak from Boo at start.

258.speaker: Minsc
258.text: Night-time raids are the height of rudeness in Rashemen. Could they not have attacked by morning?
258.context: NodeContext: Sly squeak from Boo at start.

70.speaker: Minsc
70.text: I return to my blankets. And should I be killed in my sleep, I warn you - Boo will be testy come dawn.

259.speaker: Minsc
259.text: Tell me, now that you have met Jaheira's children... it is not unpleasant to see her on the rough side of someone's tongue, hm?
259.context: NodeContext: Sly squeak from Boo at start.

222.speaker: Minsc
222.text: NO, BOO, YOU WILL NOT TELL HER! MINSC SAID NOTHING!
222.context: NodeContext: Sly squeak from Boo at start.

57.speaker: Minsc
57.text: We will not speak of this again.

264.speaker: Minsc
264.text: Hoho! That move - the wizard's twiddly little spell-fingers availed him little against Dame Aylin's anger.
264.context: NodeContext: Relish at having scene Aylin break Lorroakan's back with 'that move'

193.speaker: Minsc
193.text: But that anger sours into something gloomier, I think. Go comfort her, Boo - I can ask Aylin to demonstrate her skills another time.
193.context: NodeContext: Relish softening into empathy - he's sought revenge himself in the past, and knows it's a hollow feeling. Setting his enthusiasm aside.
